description: From Middle French politie, from Latin politia (circa 1530s C.E.), from Ancient Greek πολιτεία (politeía, “polity, policy, the state”). Doublet of policy and police.

entries.meaning: (politics) An organizational structure of the government of a state, church, etc.
(political science) A politically organized unit; a state.
examples: Different nations have different forms of polities, from provinces and states to territories and municipalities.
